translation.ko: "앤드루 모건 칼리프 담당 사회복지사" 경찰들이 하고 싶은 대로 한다고 느꼈던 것 같아요

translation.en: [Alves] Children were always being profiled. Stop-and-frisk was involved then.
translation.ko: 그 아이들은 프로파일링당하고 그런 다음 불시 검문으로 이어지죠

translation.en: So, it was, like, everyday occurrence.
Sometimes, I would say, "Who got stopped today?"
It's just part of the course.
Every single day, a ton of people are falsely arrested in this city.
translation.ko: "존 미헌 인권 변호사" 이 도시에서는 매일 많은 사람이 부당하게 체포당하곤 합니다

translation.en: When something happens, the police department
will just grab someone in the immediate vicinity of something.
translation.ko: 근처에 있는 사람을 붙잡고 보는 거죠

translation.en: [Prestia] Kalief was walking home with a friend of his.
translation.ko: 칼리프는 친구와 함께 집으로 가는 중이었어요

translation.en: They were stopped by police officers…
put against the wall, handcuffed almost immediately.
There was a victim in the car.
A spotlight was shone on them from the police car,
translation.ko: 차 안에서 환한 조명을 그들에게 비추었어요

translation.en: which, of course, is inherently suggestive.
[woman] They told you that this person had accused you of robbing him.
[Kalief] They searched me. I didn't have nothing. He said, "Let me go talk to the guy."
translation.ko: 저를 수색했지만 아무것도 없었죠 피해자와 얘기해 본다고 하더군요

translation.en: They ask very directed questions,
like, "Isn't this the guy who did it? Is this the guy who did it?"
translation.ko: 저 사람 맞지 않냐 저 사람이 그랬냐고 물어봐요

translation.en: [woman] Then they went back, and he said, "No, this person tried to rob me."
translation.ko: 그리고 경찰이 다시 와서 제가 강도 미수라고 했죠

translation.en: [Kalief] I said, "How did I try to rob him?" He said, "Let me finish talking to him."
translation.ko: 어떻게 내 짓이라고 하냐니까 경찰이 다시 얘기해 본댔어요

translation.en: If the person immediately says, "You know, I'm not sure. I'm not sure."
translation.ko: 처음 몇 번은 피해자가 잘 모르겠다고 대답해요

translation.en: Then the third time says, "Maybe it was," that creates probable cause.
translation.ko: 그러다 '맞을지도 모르겠네요'라고 말이 바뀌면서 체포 사유가 돼요

translation.en: [Kalief] When he came back, the guy said, "I robbed him two weeks ago."
translation.ko: 경찰이 다시 와서 하는 말이 제가 2주 전에 강도질을 했대요

translation.en: He changed his story three times.
The witness is changing his story back and forth.
This person was contradicting himself on when the robbery occurred
translation.ko: 언제 사건이 발생했는지 모순되는 이야기를 하는데

translation.en: and, quite frankly, even if it occurred.
[Gregory] There was multiple errors in the police paperwork.
The dates are all screwed up.
[Prestia] He was arrested on May 15th 2010.
In the criminal complaint, it was alleged
that the robbery took place on May 2nd, 2010.
In another police report, it's alleged that it was May 8th, 2010.
So, right there, you have inconsistency from the victim.
translation.ko: 피해자가 일관성이 없다는 게 이렇게 드러나는 겁니다

translation.en: When the defendants were brought into the precinct,
translation.ko: "제임스 누씨포로 전 NYPD 형사" 범죄자가 관할서로 오면

translation.en: there was no immediate follow-up by a detective on the date of arrest.
translation.ko: 체포 당일에는 형사가 바로 개입하지 않습니다

translation.en: And that may be important…
because the location where the original crime occurred
and the location of the arrest two weeks later
were in close proximity.
Go to that alley, check the lighting conditions.
You may go there and say,
"I don't know how this complainant is ID'ing the perps.
It's pretty dark in this alley."
They could have applied for a search warrant
to go and search the residences of Kalief and Shamel.
translation.ko: 칼리프와 샤멜 집을 수색할 수도 있었죠

translation.en: Perhaps credit cards were around. Perhaps the camera was around.
Perhaps the backpack was around.
That said, if I'm a victim of a crime,
and I see the suspect walking down the street,
and I notify a police officer, "That person robbed me
two hours in the past, two days, two weeks,
two months, or two years in the past,"
that police officer has to make that arrest.
They don't have any recourse.
And that's what happened in this situation.
-[woman] Good evening. -[Kalief] Good evening.
[woman] You are Mr. Kalief Browder.
-Is that correct? -[Kalief] Yes.
[woman] Do you know why you were arrested in this case?
They said that I, um…
They said I tried to rob somebody.
Then they told me that I robbed somebody previously.
One of those.
[woman] Did you rob somebody in the beginning part of May?
-Mr. Browder? -No, no.
Okay. So, you have no idea why you were arrested?
No.
[woman] Do you recall what time you arrived at central booking?
[Kalief] About 6:30 a.m.
It was scary, just in central bookings alone.
It was older guys, and I see people making threats.
translation.ko: 나이 많은 사람들도 있고 종종 협박하기도 해요

translation.en: [woman] Did you have an attorney with you?
[Kalief] I had a Legal Aid.
[Prestia] Kalief's defense attorney at the time,
I think, could have been more adamant in his representation and more vigorous.
translation.ko: 좀 더 단호하고 적극적으로 변호할 수도 있었어요

translation.en: [O'Meara on phone] Um, yeah, I mean--
translation.ko: "브렌던 오마라 칼리프의 국선 변호인" 그러니까 저도...

translation.en: I wish I could tell you more. It just is what it is.
The whole case sucked.
That public defender, he's not judged on his acquittal rate.
translation.ko: "버나드 케릭 전 뉴욕 교정부 위원장" 국선 변호인은 무죄 선고율로 평가받지 않아요

translation.en: He's judged on how many cases he can get off his desk.
[Jones] Public defenders are some of the best people in the world.
But they're given caseloads that would destroy a small law firm,
translation.ko: 하지만 작은 법률 사무소가 맡을 만큼의 사건을

translation.en: and they're just one person.
[woman] Did you eventually get brought before a judge?
[Kalief] Yes.
[Gregory] This is the kind of case where you wanna really work the arraignment,
see if you can get the lowest bail or maybe no bail.
translation.ko: 보석금을 줄이거나 없앨 가능성이 있는 사건이에요

translation.en: If this judge sets a substantial bail, he's never getting out on the case.
translation.ko: 만약 판사가 보석금을 높게 책정하면 보석으로 풀려날 길이 없죠

translation.en: If this judge sets no bail, he's out.
translation.ko: 하지만 보석금이 없다면 그냥 나오는 겁니다

translation.en: So, just let him go, get him out of there, because something's gonna happen to him.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있을지 모르니 그냥 꺼내주는 게 최선이에요

translation.en: -[woman] Was bail set? -[Kalief] Yes.
[woman] How much was the bail? [Kalief] Three thousand.
The first thing you could say is just the significance of a little bit of money.
translation.ko: 적은 금액의 중대함을 먼저 말할 수 있겠네요

translation.en: [man] The majority of people who are accused in the Bronx,
it doesn't matter if it's a million-dollars bail
or a $750 bail.
They just don't have the means to get out.
[Venida] Bail was set at 3,000, but the bond was 900.
Sounds like a small amount…
but when you don't have it, you don't have it.
And I did not have it.
And I couldn't do anything. This was my child.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 게 없었죠 내 아이 일인데

translation.en: They took my child from me, just snatched him off the street.
translation.ko: 내 아이를 길에서 무작정 데려간 거잖아요

translation.en: [woman] Let's continue.
When you were brought before a judge,
translation.ko: "칼리프 브라우더 대 뉴욕 시 첫 진술: 2014년 12월 5일" 판사 앞에 섰을 때 어떤 판결을 받았는지 알았어요?

translation.en: did you learn what charges you were facing?
translation.ko: 판사 앞에 섰을 때 어떤 판결을 받았는지 알았어요?

translation.en: [Kalief] Robbery, robbery in the second degree.
-[woman] Was bail set? -[Kalief] Yes.
[Robinson] Do we really think that $3,000 was gonna make the difference
translation.ko: 칼리프가 다시 재판에 올지 안 올지가

translation.en: between whether he came back to court or not?
[man] A lot of people just go to the ATM.
translation.ko: 많은 사람이 곧장 현금인출기로 갈 겁니다

translation.en: But we're sitting in the poorest congressional district in the country.
translation.ko: "에즈라 리친 브롱크스 자유 기금 이사" 하지만 이곳은 국내에서 가장 가난한 구역이에요

translation.en: Eighty-five to 90 percent of people can't make bail right out of arraignment.
From what I know, you know, my mom told me she didn't have the money.
And it was true. She didn't have the money.
It was a lot for my mom.
[Ritchin] When you don't make bail, then you would go to a bail bondsman.
translation.ko: "보석 보증" 보석금이 없으면 보석 보증인을 찾아갑니다

translation.en: Hi, how may I help you?
[Ritchin] Bondsmen are for-profit companies.
We help work with the families with some type of collateral,
translation.ko: 보석금 마련을 돕습니다 "레날도 리바스 리오 보석 보증인"

translation.en: doesn't always have to be cash.
We take jewelry. We take 401K life insurances.
translation.ko: "새다 톰슨 보석 보증인" 보석이나 퇴직 연금 생명 보험 등을 받아요

translation.en: Furs, cars, houses, things like that.
[Jones] You say, "Well, jeez, that seems bizarre."
What they are being punished for
is that they don't have enough money to make bail.
That's their crime.
[Alexander] Our court system isn't saying they can't be released to society.
translation.ko: 그들을 사회로 보내지 않겠다는 게 아니에요

translation.en: Our court system is saying they have to cough up some cash first.
translation.ko: 나가려면 돈부터 내라는 게 우리 사법 체계의 요구죠

translation.en: [Nicole] Our family, we didn't have money like that.
My father just recently left, and, you know, my mom…
my mom depended on him.
She had to rely on whatever he could give her.
She had no food in the house.
Ma, you need help?
-No, I got it. -You sure?
Yeah.
She couldn't work because she has heart problems.
translation.ko: 심장에 문제가 있어 일을 할 수도 없으셨어요

translation.en: [Venida] I had my first heart attack in 2000.
And then, in 2007, I had my second heart attack.
That's the one that did me in.
Part of my heart's dead, it's gone.
It only pumps 25 percent.
And the medicine I take is not to make me get better.
It's just to keep me going.
[Nicole] It was hard. It was really, really hard.
[woman] Is your father currently employed? [Kalief] He's retired.
[woman] As far as the job he had, do you know what he did?
translation.ko: 아버지가 이전에 무슨 일을 하셨는지 알아요?

translation.en: [Kalief] He worked for the MTA.
[Nicole] My father used to work all the time.
[man] It seems like your father could've paid the bail.
He could've.
He could've.
[Venida] He had already made up his mind.
"Oh, if Kalief is in Rikers, something is wrong."
He just kept saying, "Oh, no, he's bad. He's bad."
The only thing we could think of was to ask our neighbor
translation.ko: 유일한 방법은 이웃에게 도움을 청하는 거였어요

translation.en: that used to live across the street, and he gave us the money.
We went to Bail Bonds, 161st Street.
translation.ko: 우린 곧장 161번가 보석 보증인을 찾아갔어요 "보석 보증"

translation.en: And the guy was doing the paperwork, he accepted the money.
translation.ko: 서류 작성을 하는 사람이 돈을 받아줬고

translation.en: And then he's typing stuff in the computer,
and then he said, "Oh, bail is denied."
So, I'm like, "What are you talking about?"
And that's when he said, "Because he violated probation."
[Prestia] He was sentenced to probation
for riding in a bakery truck with another friend of his.
translation.ko: 훔쳐 탄 일로 보호 관찰 대상이 됐어요

translation.en: [Gregory] He was on felony probation.
He violated the probation by getting rearrested.
translation.ko: 다시 체포돼서 보호 관찰을 위반한 게 되는 거죠

translation.en: He might have been an innocent guy, but that's not something
that's magically determined by, you know, some force of nature.
That has to play itself out.
The Department of Probation can say, "We're gonna put a hold on you."
translation.ko: 보호 관찰 부서에서는 '보류한다'라고 말할 수 있어요

translation.en: Meaning you can't leave jail until this case is resolved.
translation.ko: 사건이 종결될 때까지 보석이 없다는 뜻이죠

translation.en: And that's what they did here.
[woman] In New York State, for a 16 or 17 or 18-year-old,
they are treated like an adult.
They are charged like an adult. They are sentenced like an adult.
translation.ko: "로빈 스타인버그 브롱크스 변호인단 설립자" 성인과 똑같이 기소되고 형량을 받고

translation.en: They are sent to Rikers Island like an adult.
[Robinson] Kalief was imprisoned at Rikers Island.
It's isolated. It's away from our view.
Some people have called it New York's own tiny little Guantanamo Bay.
translation.ko: 어떤 사람들은 그곳을 뉴욕의 관타나모만이라고 했어요

translation.en: [female reporter] Officers and inmates at risk on Rikers Island.
This stuff breaks grown men, let alone a young guy.
translation.ko: 어린 청년은 고사하고 성인 남자도 망가뜨립니다

translation.en: [Steinberg] The only way you're gonna come home to your family
translation.ko: 유죄를 인정해야만 가족 품으로 돌아갈 수 있어요

translation.en: is to plead guilty, whether or not you did it.
translation.ko: 유죄를 인정해야만 가족 품으로 돌아갈 수 있어요 범죄를 저질렀든 아니든요

translation.en: And anybody who thinks that you won't plead guilty to get off Rikers Island
translation.ko: 누가 섬을 탈출하려고 거짓으로 유죄를 인정하겠냐고 되묻는 사람이 있다면 안 가봐서 그러는 거예요

translation.en: has not been to Rikers Island.
translation.ko: 되묻는 사람이 있다면 안 가봐서 그러는 거예요

translation.en: You would plead guilty to anything
to get off something that violent and that frightening.
[Kalief] I didn't do it. You're not gonna make me say I did something just so I could go home.
translation.ko: 난 아니야, 집에 가려고 거짓 자백을 하진 않을 거야

translation.en: If I gotta stay here just to prove that I'm innocent, then so be it.
translation.ko: 결백 주장을 위해 이곳에 남아야 한다면 남겠어

translation.en: [man] I feel sorry for adolescents coming to the prison system
because I know they're gonna get violated.
translation.ko: "대릴 브라이언트 전 라이커스 교도관" 모든 권리를 침해당하는 곳이거든요

translation.en: [Kalief] It's hell on Earth.
